intro: Endiandra hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan endiandra, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and distinctive, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and is adapted to humid, warm climates. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in local medicine for their purported health benefits. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
